concise_definition: v. 阅读, 朗读, 理解; n. 阅读, 读物

definitions.explanation_en: To look at and understand the meaning of written or printed words by interpreting symbols, letters, or characters.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过解读文字、字母或符号来理解书面或印刷内容的含义。
definitions.example_en: She reads three novels every month to improve her vocabulary.
definitions.example_cn: 她每月读三本小说以扩大词汇量。

definitions.explanation_en: To speak or recite written words aloud, often for the benefit of others.
definitions.explanation_cn: 大声朗读或复述书面文字，通常是为了让他人聆听。
definitions.example_en: The teacher asked the student to read the poem aloud to the class.
definitions.example_cn: 老师让学生为全班朗读这首诗。

definitions.explanation_en: To interpret or understand information presented in a non-verbal or symbolic form, such as signs, data, or expressions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 解读以非语言或符号形式呈现的信息，如标志、数据或表情。
definitions.example_en: He can read body language very well and knows when someone is lying.
definitions.example_cn: 他非常擅长解读肢体语言，能判断出谁在撒谎。

definitions.explanation_en: An act or instance of reading, especially as a leisure activity; also refers to a book or text that is enjoyable or informative to read.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指阅读的行为或一次阅读经历，尤指作为休闲活动；也可指一本有趣或有启发性的读物。
definitions.example_en: This mystery novel is a great read for a rainy afternoon.
definitions.example_cn: 这本侦探小说是雨天午后绝佳的读物。

comparison.analysis: “Scan”（浏览/快速查看）指快速地、不深入地查看文字或信息，目的是获取大意或寻找特定内容，而非仔细理解。而 “read” 强调专注、完整地理解内容，通常伴随思考和记忆。
“Study”（研究/钻研）比 “read” 更深入，通常包含分析、记忆、批判性思考和反复查阅，常用于学术或专业语境。而 “read” 可以是轻松的、表面的，不一定伴随深度思考。
“Interpret”（解释/诠释）侧重于对模糊、抽象或非文字信息（如艺术、语言、行为）赋予意义，常涉及主观判断。而 “read” 在非字面用法中虽可表示‘理解’，但更强调从已明确表达的信息中提取含义，如读图表、读表情。
